author: sky.cactus
content: Does anyone have a recommendation for a VPN server?  Something that supports network sharing (meaning two routers in different locations would connect to the VPN server and it would "merge" the two networks.  I currently use OpenVPN Access Server, but their licensing model is ridiculous and I need more simultaneous clients than the free version allows.

author: maidok
content: Or wireguard (which Tailscale is based on) https://www.procustodibus.com/blog/2020/12/wireguard-site-to-site-config/

author: emile8096
content: I use sshuttle for support and routinely have access to multiple remote networks from my at home desktop.

author: emile8096
content: Then it's sudo sshuttle -v -r user@f.q.d.n:port 192.168.3.0/24 and I can access all 192.168.3.nnn
